metadata.title: CVE-2024-42247 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:wireguard: allowedips: avoid unaligned 64-bit memory accessesOn the parisc platform, the kernel issues kernel warnings becauseswap_endian() tries to load a 128-bit IPv6 address from an unalignedmemory location: Kernel: unaligned access to 0x55f4688c inwg_allowedips_insert_v6+0x2c/0x80 [wireguard] (iir 0xf3010df) Kernel: unaligned access to 0x55f46884 inwg_allowedips_insert_v6+0x38/0x80 [wireguard] (iir 0xf2010dc)Avoid such unaligned memory accesses by instead using theget_unaligned_be64() helper macro.[Jason: replace src[8] in original patch with src+8]
